Abstract: This study explores the impact of robo-advice on transforming households into more rational economic agents. By leveraging advanced algorithms and machine learning, robo-advisors provide personalized financial guidance, influencing consumption, debt management, and investment decisions. The research integrates insights from FinTech, household finance, and behavioral finance to assess how these technological tools mitigate cognitive biases and enhance financial literacy. Empirical analysis reveals significant improvements in household financial health, with reduced debt levels and optimized investment portfolios. The findings suggest that robo-advice can play a crucial role in promoting financial well-being and economic stability.
